data¶

Data Loading Ops¶

class data_reader.extractor.CreateData(name)[source]¶

Bases: object

Transform the raw data from set trec05 into instances.

Raw data found in the ./data_reader/data/raw/trec05p-1/ base folder. Subsection of available data specified through subfolder name at the time of corpus creation. In future, can be extended to include more datasets, with variable ways of specifying n-fold data generation.

base_path = None¶

Path to raw data. @TODO – User-defined variable in future implementation

corpus = None¶

List of strings containing data for each email in dataset

create_corpus(folder)[source]¶

Generate list of files, one for each future instance.

Parameters:folder (str) – Path specifying %ham and %spam emails
create_instances(category)[source]¶

Use the fitted model to transform the corpus into feature vectors

Parameters:category (str) – Test or train
find_files(index_path)[source]¶

Generate list of file paths, one for each future instance.

Parameters:index_path (str) – Path containing file that specifies locations of raw files
Returns:file paths (List(str))
labels = None¶

True classification labels, as specified by raw data (ham vs. spam)

num_instances = None¶

Number of instances within the current corpus

save_data(category, tfidf_matrix: scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix)[source]¶

Output the generated feature vectors and known labels to file

Parameters:
  • category (str) – Test or train
  • tfidf_matrix (csr_matrix) – num_instances X feature_count
tf = None¶

Sklearn module used to fit and transform data and the resulting feature matrix

tf_idf(strip_accents_=None, ngram_range_=(1, 1), max_df_=1.0, min_df_=1, max_features_=1000)[source]¶

Fit the term frequency model to the corpus

Parameters:
  • strip_accents (str) – Accents to remove
  • ngram_range (tuple) – Range of phrase lengths to analyze
  • max_df (float) – Max degree of freedom for term frequencies
  • min_df (int) – Min dgree of freedom for term frequencies
  • max_features – Maximim number of features to pull from the corpus

Data Storage¶

class data_reader.input.FeatureVector(num_features: int, feature_indices: typing.List[int])[source]¶

Bases: object

Feature vector data structure.

Contains sparse representation of boolean features. Defines basic methods for manipulation and data format changes.

add_feature(index, feature)[source]¶

Add feature at given index.

Switches the current value at the index to the specified value.

Args:
index (int): Index of feature update. feature (int): Boolean, (0/1)
copy(feature_vector)[source]¶
feature_difference(xa) → typing.List[source]¶
flip_bit(index)[source]¶

Flip feature at given index.

Switches the current value at the index to the opposite value. {0 –> 1, 1 –> 0}

Args:
index (int): Index of feature update.
get_csr_matrix() → scipy.sparse.csr.csr_matrix[source]¶

Return feature vector represented by sparse matrix.

get_feature(index: int) → int[source]¶

Return value of feature at index

Parameters:index (int) – Feature index.
get_feature_count()[source]¶

Return static number of features.

remove_feature(index)[source]¶

Remove feature at given index.

If the feature at [index] is 0, no action is taken.

Args:
index (int): Index of feature to remove.
class data_reader.input.Instance(label: int, feature_vector: data_reader.input.FeatureVector)[source]¶

Bases: object

Instance data structure.

Container for feature vector and mapped label.

Return underlying feature vector.

get_label()[source]¶

Return current classification label.

Set classification to new value.

Parameters:val (int) – New classification label.

Serialize Ops¶

data_reader.output.save_battle(battle, battle_name)[source]¶

Save battle at a given state of execution.

Parameters:
  • battle (Battle) – Existing object containing learner and adversary in a given state.
  • battle_name (str) – User-specified name of battle.
data_reader.output.save_data(category: str, name: str, instances: typing.List[typing.List[int]])[source]¶

Save instances extracted from corpus.

Parameters:
  • category (str) – Train or Test.
  • name (str) – User-specified name of dataset.
  • instances (List[List[int]) – Raw data to save.
data_reader.output.save_predictions(battle_name: str, data: str, predictions: typing.List)[source]¶

Save learner generated predictions.

Parameters:
  • battle_name (str) – User-specified name of battle.
  • data (str) – Name of dataset that was transformed.
  • predictions (List) – Predictions for each instance.
data_reader.output.save_transformed_instances(battle_name: str, data: str, instances: typing.List[data_reader.input.Instance])[source]¶

Save data from a specified file.

Parameters:
  • battle_name (str) – User-specified name of battle.
  • data (str) – Name of dataset that was transformed.
  • instances (List[Instance]) – Transformed instances to save.
